captions.text:
Al capone.
We have no mr. Capone--
I know, get him.

We have no mr. Capone--
I said, goddamn it--
I said...

Something
you want here?
My friend was killed today.

I don't care.
You don't care.
Now he does.

Come out here,
capone.
You want to fight?

You want to fight?
You and me, right here?

That's it,
come on!

What's the matter? You afraid to
come out from behind your men,
To stand up for yourself?

You wanna do it now?
You wanna go to the mat now?

Come on,
you guinea son of a bitch!

What?
Easy.

You talk to me like that
in front of my son?
Fuck you and your family!
Fu--?

Easy. It's me.
It's me!

Not this way.
Not this way.

You fuck,
you got nothing!

You're nothing but
a lot of talk and a badge.

You're here because you got
nothing. Nothing in court,

You don't got the bookkeeper,
you've got nothing! Nothing!

And if you were a man,
you would've done it now!

You don't got a thing,
you punk!

title: The Untouchables (6/10) Movie CLIP - You Got Nothing! (1987) HD

comments.text:
+wizkid8205 I thought you were gonna leave? You said you're "done" with 
this, so why are you replying TWICE? For someone who thinks calling someone 
a "girl" is an insult, I could simply say that a man follows his words and 
that'd be giving you a huge bitchslap, but as much as I love adding injury 
to insult, I've already stated previously that you're a bitch so this has 
already been stated.
Moreover trying to call me corny when you've been pulling everything from 
the book CoD kids use to insult people is just being a hypocrite, then 
again I've already called you on it.
Notice a pattern there? I've long been predicting what you're gonna write 
before you do. That's how used your shit is. You literally can't come up 
with anything new, yet still feel the need to keep it up as if you needed 
to prove something. You've even resorted to imitating me, which if you 
haven't noticed (and I bet you haven't), means you accept that my responses 
to your pathetic attempts at offending someone are far superior to anything 
your under developed brain could imagine.
I didn't even comment on your "this ain't even fun no more" line 
previously, but since you want to insist, OK. That's the classic response a 
butthurt little crying kid gives when trying to pass off as a troll that 
had a great time, when in reality he's raging like a teenage girl who 
watches a Bieber critic video.
No I'm not calling you a teenage girl, just like I'm not calling you a 9 
year old boy. There's mental similarities but that's about it. Still, if 
the shoe fits, and it does, wear it.

INB4 another "joke" pulled straight from the CoD guide on how to make fun 
of people's family and/or sexual identity.
I'd also say INB4 a kill yourself comment but you already added something 
like that.

comments.text:
Let me welcome everybody to the wild-wild west. A state that’s UNTOUCHABLE 
like Elliot Ness.

I must of use this line about once a day for a week many years ago! I 
thought it was pretty cool to have the phrase highlighted in a Dr. Dre Rap 
song!

Anyhow KC and RD at their best. x

The scene is quite violent, however the confrontation was so climatic and 
if you were watching it for the first time the anticipation to find out 
what happens next was very inviting.

The part where Kevin punches the guy in the face was hilarious.
Enjoy the scene from one of my favorite films of all time ! :)﻿

comments.text:
Not according to history. Yes, Ness had very little interaction with Capone 
if any before Capone was finally incarcerated, but Ness was a huge thorn in 
Capone's side busting up his bootlegging enterprise and building a sizable 
case against Capone which could have been brought to court had the 
government not taken the easy way out by going with tax evasion. Ness was 
the ONLY guy brave enough to take on Capone and his criminal enterprise in 
Chicago since Capone was able to buy everyone else off.

true nature. For example, in this movie, Capone is living in a fancy hotel 
which NEVER happened. Capone lived in a middle class house which is still 
standing in Chicago. His house is very similar to the one I grew up 
in...I'm from Chicago.

comments.text:
Once the IRS received a return from Capone, one of two things would have 
happened. If Capone had told the truth about how he got the money, then 
they would've arrested and convicted him for bootlegging,. If Capone lied 
about how he got the money, he'd get busted for filing a false return. So 
much for dumb fuck lol
